title: What champion?
body:
I have recently started playing LoL and i was wondering which champions to buy. I am currently level 22 and my favorite champion is Orianna. I main mid and i currently own Kat,Yasuo,Orianna,Annie and Ryze. I was thinking about cassiopeia but she seems like a really high skill cap so im currently saving for xerath. Please comment your suggestion down below.

-Bad Sardine

replies.body:
If you're good with Orianna, you could pretty much play any champion you'd want. She is one of the hardest champions to really master, besides maybe Yasuo (No, I'm not a Yas player, I actually hate the champions' kit all together). 

Regarding your next point, Xerath is a champion where either you're good with skill shots, or you're not. His kit is run souly around the fact of skill, map awareness, and timing. If you can get those three down, then sure pick him up. He's not really known to be a hypercarry, but you CAN if you get far ahead during laning phase. He's designed to poke with his Q,W, or catch someone with your e and collapse.

Making another point* 

Asking people on the forums about what champions are good and what aren't isn't the best thing to do. No champion is "bad", they're just not good against certain matchups. I play A LOT of Aatrox and win my lane 95% of the time, with a few exceptions like Jayce or some other instant-burst top lane. 

Play a champion that YOU are interested in, not something that is good because an LCS player said so. You won't get where you could playing something you are told is good, but you don't actually enjoy playing x champion. It's like you doing something you don't like, but your friends are telling and peer pressuring you to do it, not cool right?
Yea I understand, ill try to play most free week champions and see which ones fit me the best.

I would suggest you get Champs for other lanes and start building skills made for your secondary roles aswell as you will not have the opportunity to always MID lane. As well, ALWAYS have at least 1 support champ. You may require to auto-fill it. As of now, from what I've read, your only support is Annie, which is fine, but you may want to get something more viable.

Nami is Love, Nami is Life. 

Seriously though, what this guy said^

Start figuring out a secondary lane, and you'll have a much easier time of it. Personally, I suggest picking up at least three support champions so you can always play if they get banned and you're autofilled. Otherwise, just start looking into other roles you could play.
I currently own Soraka and Annie. Should i get taric or Janna for support?

They do such different things that it's hard to say. You need someone who can disengage well. 

Alistar or Braum would be good.  Taric can be phenomenal if you get good with his ultimate. 

I never liked Janna, but she's very strong if you're good with her. Very hard to kill her. 

My #1 support right now is Nami, but she's an expensive pickup if you don't have runes yet.
I already own champs for most lanes but not for support/adc so i will make sure to get some of those.

get one you like for each role just incase 
good starters are
Garen top
Ashe adc
Annie "can" support, but I suggest getting Soraka
and for jg try Warwick or Udyr

as for mid, try Brand :3
I already own most of the 450 champions but i will think about udyr and brand

Brand's combo is, 3rd, 1st, 2nd aka E, Q, W
best to max W first then Q next
Liandrys{{item:3151}}  and Morellonomicon{{item:3165}} are key items you'll need

Udyr  is mostly a jungler but can go top, thought it may be difficult
for jungle get them in the order, Q, W or E, then R 
max Q first
Trinity force{{item:3078}}  is a key item you'll need

best wishes

You don't really need any adcs' if you have no plans on going there. Supp you may automatically land without choice which is why I mention supp. If you do plan on getting an adc, I would suggest Ezreal, Corki, Varus or Kog Maw since they play like a mid laner but can AD carry. It would come to you more naturally as per say a Vayne or Caitlyn.

{{champion:103}} Skill shot reliant but very forgiving
{{champion:69}} Landing Q's is difficult to get used to especially if the enemy team has mobility spells
{{champion:55}} Good.... however if someone is smart, they can pick a lane bully and with correct positioning they can pretty much shut you down with 0 counterplay
{{champion:1}} I like annie, good lane phase, good roam potential, good cc, good burst.
{{champion:13}} Ih... I personally don't believe he is that good, might just be because I play {{champion:69}} almost exclusivly against him though, he doesn't have any mobility and if you mess up a combo it can mean death in an instant, also has low range.
{{champion:157}} Ooooooooh boy, do I love me this Champion, however, I don't recommend picking him up unless you understand that he will be banned... a lot.
{{champion:101}} Everyhting is a skillshot, if you don't land them consistantly, and have good positioning, your lack of mobility will be the death of you.
{{champion:7}} I don't play against her much, no opinion from me :/
{{champion:134}} I see a lot of Syndras getting camped every game they are in my game, I don't think it is good
I already own yasuo but i will probably get Cassiopeia. I tried ahri but she has a very dull game play experience in my opinion.
I main Ahri fk you.... (sarcasm)
youd probably like syndra or leblanc

Xerath is 100% skill based, every single one of his abilities are skillshots, which means you can do a ton of damage, or deal zero damage.

I used to love playing the champion, so I'd never tell you not to get him, but I don't play him much any longer as if I have a bad game I contribute virtually nothing to my team.
I'm decent with skill shots so ill pick him up with Cassiopeia and possibly malazahar
He's super rewarding if you're good at hitting his abilities, he was always very feast or famine for me though. I'd go off and have an absurdly high KDA, or I'd not do much of anything.
his w and ult are more of an aoe rather than a skillshot...
It's still an ability that you have to aim, and they're both very easily missed. Being in the shape of a circle doesn't make it any less of a skillshot.

{{champion:90}}   is very fun to play
and his ult is a point and click suppress
Before i buy him ill try him in free week but thanks for the suggestion

{{champion:103}} always a safe pick
{{champion:69}} the only skill cap she has is the positioning in between E's and actually landing Q's, honestly. 
{{champion:45}} infinite ap scaling, fun fun
{{champion:245}} {{champion:134}}  braindead
{{champion:7}} permabanned in pro scene, must be good
Thanks for the tips ill make sure to reconsider Cassiopeia
